pullrequest.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

content.raw:
We did something similar to resolve #494 in [sdformat pull request 83](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/83/sdf-15-add-flag-to-fix-joint-axis-frame-43/diff). In that instance, we made the default value of the flag in sdf 1.4 correspond to the legacy (incorrect) behavior, and the default value in sdf 1.5 correspond to the "correct" behavior. The conversion script from 1.4 to 1.5 was used as well.

So if we add a flag to `sdf/1.5`, it's default value should match the legacy behavior, and using the "correct" behavior will require explicitly setting the flag. We can change the default value when we move to sdf 1.6, though we'll probably wait a while to jump to that, since it's a bit of a hassle to increase the version number.

Does that make sense?
